data.title: Incorrect css for JS contant objects or functions
cli: Open stdin as a file when present
data.body:
The [atom cli discards its input from stdin](https://discuss.atom.io/t/it-would-be-nice-to-be-able-to-pipe-standard-out-to-atom-and-have-it-open-in-an-unsaved-document/4781) when other editors would open a new document containing that text.

This change writes input from stdin to a new temporary file and inserts that file as the first argument to the atom executable.
It only does that when stdin is not at tty, i.e. running `git diff | atom` creates and opens a temporary file but running `atom some/file` does not.

Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1729
## Caveats
- [ ] Errors from `mktemp` are not handled.
- [ ] The call to `mktemp` appears before ensuring that `TMPDIR` is set on line 105.
- [ ] `mktemp` is called without arguments, resulting in a filename like `tmp.XXXXXXXX`.  
  A filename prefix like `atom-stdin` would be nicer but the mktemp commands on [Linux](http://www.unix.com/man-page/linux/1/mktemp/) and [OS X](http://www.unix.com/man-page/osx/1/mktemp/) are sufficiently different to make this more involved. (A call like `mktemp -t atom-stdin` would work on OS X but wouldn't include a random suffix on Linux, if I understand the man page correctly.)

data.title: Fuzzy search items disappear after one second
data.body:
When I open "fuzzy search" (Cmd + P) there's a list of recently used files.
I hit no keys and then, after a second, the list of recently used files changes with the recently used files out of the list this time.
Is this a bug?
I'm using the latest Atom on OS X.

data.title: Finding MarkerLayers after they are created
data.body:
I'm looking to access the `MarkerLayer` created by another package in my own package. It appears that when `MarkerLayer`s are created, they are assigned an `id`, but there doesn't appear to be a way to find a specific `MarkerLayer` via its current `id` without knowing the `id`.

Can we get a way to access (non-default) `MarkerLayers` outside of our own packages once they are created?

data.title: Haskell-ghc-mod: ghc-mod command check failed with error Error
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. Make a file with this contents 
   
   module Main where
   
   import Lib
   import Control.Monad(forever)
   import Data.Char (toLower)
   import Data.Maybe (isJust)
   import Data.List (intersperse)
   import System.Exit(exitSuccess)
   import System.Ramdom(randomRIO)
   
   type WordList = [String]
   
   minWordLength :: Int
   minWordLength = 5
   
   maxWordLength :: Int
   maxWordLength = 9
   
   allWords :: IO WordList
   allWords = do
     dict <- readfille ¨data/words
     return (lines dict)
   
   gameWords :: IO WordList
   gameWords = do
     aw <- allWords
     return (filter gameLength aw)
     where gameLength w =
       let l = length (w :: String)
       in l > winWordLength && l < maxWordLength
   
   randomWord :: Wordlist -> IO String
   randomWord wl = do
     randomIndex <- randomIO ( 0, length wl - 1 )
     return $ wl !! randomIndex
   
   randomWord' :: IO String
   randomWord' = gameWords >>= randomWord
2. .Save the file 

_Atom Version__: 1.5.4
*_System**: Ubuntu 15.10
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

data.title: Searching also inside ignored paths when we are explicitly searching inside one of its parents directories
data.body:
### Description

Ignored paths are still searched for when we are searching inside one of its parent directories.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Have a structure like this:
   - /dir/.cache
   - /dir/foo
   - /dir/bar
2. Add `.cache` to `.gitignore` and be sure that Atom won't search inside this path
3. Search for something and set the root directory as `dir` instead of the default

**Expected behavior:** The `.cache` folder should still be filtered out from the search results.

**Actual behavior:** It's not.
### Versions

1.6.0-beta8

data.title: The application Atom has closed unexpectedly
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- ~~[ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?~~ Cannot reproduce.
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Atom crashed on Linux when installed on the https://atlas.hashicorp.com/box-cutter/boxes/ubuntu1404-desktop vagrant box.
### Steps to Reproduce

`Vagrantfile`

``` ruby
Vagrant.configure(2) do |config|
  config.vm.box = "box-cutter/ubuntu1404-desktop"

  config.vm.provider "virtualbox" do |v|
    v.gui = true
  end
end

```
1. Go to atom.io, and install atom
2. Launch atom
3. Close atom via the `X` icon in the top left

*_Note: *_ I cannot reproduce this.

**Expected behavior:** No crashing.

**Actual behavior:** Crashed:

![screen shot 2016-03-15 at 8 24 20 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/744740/13781203/2855b2b6-ea88-11e5-9556-5d3ee95560d0.png)
### Versions

```
$ atom --version 
1.5.4

$ apm --version
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.6
git 1.9.1
```

data.title: Can Atom build in environment of Windows 7 (sp1) & Visual Studio 2015?
data.body:
As shown below: cannot vs2015 with Win7???

<QUOTE>

Visual Studio

You can use either:

Visual Studio 2013 Update 5 (Express or better) on Windows 7, 8 or 10
Visual Studio 2015 (Community or better) with Windows 8 or 10

<QUOTE>

data.title: Font "SourceHanCode JP" is not working.
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

I have "[Source Han Code Pro](https://github.com/adobe-fonts/source-han-code-jp)" installed myPC(windows7) cause I want to use the default font on atom. 
Setting font-family on `styles.less` is not working.

``` styles.less
 atom-text-editor {
   font-family: "Source Han Code JP Light", "SourceHanCodeJP-Light";
 }
```
### Versions

```
$ atom --version
1.5.3

$ apm -v
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python
git
visual studio
```

data.title: Move font settings into a single group so they are displayed together
data.body: ### Prerequisites - [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)? - [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)? - [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)? - [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)? - [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? - [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide. ### Description The "Line Height" setting has a significant visual separation from the "Font Size" and "Font Family" settings when people will often want to change them in concert with each other: ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Launch Atom 2. Open Settings view with Cmd+, on OS X or Ctrl+, on other platforms 3. Scroll down so "Font Size" and "Line Height" both appear in the same screen **Expected behavior:** "Line Height" to immediately follow "Font Size" **Actual behavior:** Large visual separation (see picture above) ### Versions ``` Atom : 1.7.0-dev-4798d6d Electron: 0.36.8 Chrome : 47.0.2526.110 Node : 5.1.1 ``` ### See Also - #11151

data.title: Keyboard shortcut to Reload Window not (always) working
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I have noticed that the keyboard-shortcut for `View > Developer > Reload Window` is not working across all the systems on which I'm using Atom.

Mac OS X 10.8.x - working
Mac OS X 10.11 - not working
Windows 10 - working
Fedora - working

I suspected conflicting keyboard shortcuts, but neither safe mode resolved this nor did the keybinding resolver find any conflicts. No errors in the console either.

**Which keyboard layout are you using?** Apple QWERTZ Keyboard (German layout)

![screen shot 2016-03-19 at 02 23 50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1504938/13895868/cf5bcc46-ed79-11e5-9cd6-ad49b7c9d054.png)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Launch Atom
2. Press <kbd>Ctrl</kbd><kbd>Alt</kbd><kbd>Cmd</kbd><kbd>L</kbd>

**Expected behavior:** The Window to reload

**Actual behavior:** The Window did not reload
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line.

``` bash
atom --version
1.5.4

apm --version
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.5.4
```

data.title: openSUSE \ SLES 12 Package is missing
data.body:
Hey,
I have seen that there is a RPM package and was wondering if it was tested on them?
Was the RPM built for usage on CentOS\RH\Fedora or also for openSUSE\SLES?

data.title: Atom fails to launch from older versions of Bash
data.body:
Running `atom .` opens Atom in local directory just fine (verifies that Git Bash can find and run executable)

Running `atom --version` in Command Prompt spits out version (1.5.4) as expected.

Running `atom --version` in Git Bash does nothing

Running `atom --version > ~/Desktop/atom_version.txt` generates an empty text file.

data.body:

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Unable to delete files / folders in atom tree view in Windows 7
### Steps to Reproduce

2. Select `Delete` option
3. Select `Move to Trash`

**Expected behavior:** File / folder to be deleted

**Actual behavior:** Nothing
### Versions

1.5.4

data.title: BufferedProcess: search only new data for new lines rather than entire buffer, take 2
data.body:
This is continuing @chuckhendo’s good work in https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/10930 by adding a spec to more thoroughly test the line-splitting we do in `BufferedProcess`.

It’s hard to test this in any sort of deterministic way since the process’s output could be split in any number of ways. So we throw a bunch of data at it and :pray: it gets split up in funny ways.

data.title: :bug: Make "Open Empty Editor on Start" config effective
data.body:
As reported on issue #10623, this config isn't effective or at least doesn't work as it sounds it should. This is due to the state persistence feature, which is unaware of this setting, restoring the editor to its last state on every startup. I agree with @ExClouds (the guy who opened the issue), when he says

> i expect the editor to open blank.. No open tabs, no open projects..

My strategy was to prevent state saving/loading when the setting is on. This is my first contribution to atom and I'm not that familiar with the code. I did what I thought would be the least intrusive changes.

data.title: atom module no longer available in tasks
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

The `atom` module can no longer be required in a task created using the `Task` class. It breaks the `fuzzy-finder` as well as any other packages that uses core classes from that module (like the `Emitter` or the `Disposable` classes).

For instance, when running in safe mode, the `fuzzy-finder` package is failing with: 

```
Cannot find module 'atom' Error: Cannot find module 'atom'
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:338:15)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:289:25)
    at Module.require (module.js:366:17)
    at require (module.js:385:17)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/fuzzy-finder/lib/load-paths-handler.js:12:19)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/fuzzy-finder/lib/load-paths-handler.js:180:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:425:26)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .js] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:208:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:313:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:366:17)
    at require (module.js:385:17)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/task-bootstrap.js:110:13)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/task-bootstrap.js:112:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:425:26)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .js] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:208:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:313:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:366:17)
    at require (module.js:385:17)
    at [eval]:2:1
    at Object.exports.runInThisContext (vm.js:54:17)
    at Object.<anonymous> ([eval]-wrapper:6:22)
    at Module._compile (module.js:425:26)
    at node.js:602:27
    at doNTCallback0 (node.js:443:9)
    at process._tickCallback (node.js:372:13)(anonymous function) @ /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/task.js:52
/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/task.js:52 Cannot read property 'bind' of null TypeError: Cannot read property 'bind' of null
    at process.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/task-bootstrap.js:82:23)
    at emitTwo (events.js:87:13)
    at process.emit (events.js:172:7)
    at handleMessage (internal/child_process.js:686:10)
    at Pipe.channel.onread (internal/child_process.js:440:11)(anonymous function) @ /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/task.js:52
```

I suspect this is a bug and was not an intended change, but if it was I may point out that this will likely break a lot of packages and should trigger a major version bump.
### Versions

```
> atom --version
Atom    : 1.7.0-dev-579b6b7
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

data.title: Cycling through windows still not working on French keyboard
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)? 
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

As initially reported in #10852 and fixed in #10927, but with `cmd-backtick` as keybinding, using a French keyboard layout (AZERTY). 
The command no longer cycles through the open Atom windows. 
I'm using a modified french layout to remove the backtick dead-key, but I have the same behaviour when using the original layout.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open several Atom windows
2. Use `cmd-backtick` to cycle through them

**Expected behavior:** It should cycle through the open windows.

**Actual behavior:** It stays on the current window.
### Versions

data.title: When files have same name, splitting panes does not copy the full folder/file name to the window title
data.body:
Please check issue on Atom discuss forum -
https://discuss.atom.io/t/when-files-have-same-name-splitting-panes-does-not-copy-the-full-folder-file-name-to-the-window-title/26533
![code window split - full filename does not copy when filenames are same](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17824719/13740119/df0b5df2-e9c6-11e5-896b-ca53bf6bacf2.jpg)

Thank you
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)? Not applicable.
- [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)? Yes
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)? Not applicable.
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)? Yes.
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? No idea.
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? Yes.

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

[Description of the bug or feature]

Please check issue details already posted here:
https://discuss.atom.io/t/when-files-have-same-name-splitting-panes-does-not-copy-the-full-folder-file-name-to-the-window-title/26533
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open two code files with the same name, but in a different folder.
2. On the first file, click View -> Panes -> Split Down.
3. On the second file, click View -> Panes -> Split Right.

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

The full folder and file name should be copied into the new pane.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

Only the file name is copied down, and therefore it is not clear what code file we are working on, in the case when two files have the same file name, however are from different folders.
### Versions

Atom version 1.5.4.

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line.

data.title: Tab bar is unable to scroll
data.body:
### Description

The tab bar is unable to scroll. 
After opening more than 20 files (depend on the window size). The newly opened file does not show on the tab.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a folder with more than 20 files.
2. Keep selecting different file until you do not see your opened file being highlighted in the tab bar.

**Expected behavior:** The tab bar should always highlight the file that is being showed in the content.
### Versions

1.5.4
